intro: Trachyandra asperata var. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed trachyandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Restionaceae. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Western Cape province, where it grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It is typically found in fynbos vegetation, thriving in areas with a Mediterranean climate. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
